Reviews.Title: Much better than I expected
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is the first 1080p 120Hz LCD Tv that I bought. I had previously purchased an LG tv however it was 720p.  This Tv is GREAT! I love the Net Tv as it has podcasts that you can watch as well as Netflix, Pandora, Facebook etc.  Setup was a breeze.  Downloading and updating the software was seamless. Yes, I am technical however non-technical people should be fine too :-)Watching tv this way I am aware of the camera angles and I feel like I am right there experiencing everything with the actors.  I purchased this tv for our Master bedroom and it is the perfect size.  I did purchase a digital antenna so we could get the local channels for free and I also purchased a Roku.  The only thing this tv is missing is a Web browser.  That being said the picture quality is great and the Surround Sound is pretty good.  We have speakers in the bedroom from our previous living room set and hubby is taking his sweet time in hooking it up since the sound from just the tv alone is great.I definitely recommend this tv and I feel pretty pleased about my selection.  Trust that I researched the heck out of multiple tvs before choosing this one.

Reviews.Title: A great set, Awesome display
Reviews.Author: Marlon P
Reviews.Content: I was at 1st reluctant to purchase this set, since I have always satisfied with Samsung products. But because of thesale at the time and its a 120hz system I jumped at it.Upon arrival it was very easy to handle, one person can handle this set very easily. Easy setup, the remote is a little confusing, but after 10 minutes I was breezing right along.The picture is awesome, I have Comcast hd and this set just pops with lively color, its truly remarkable.The sound quality is great, but i have a Onkyo surround sound system makes the sound stand out. The 120hz video makes gaming, I have no words to describe.I have not tried the other features, but am eager to try the internet feature. It has a built in WiFi or you can hardwire straight to it with an Ethernet connection.Phillips has won me, even though I still like Samsung products, I will still look at Phillips before I make final decision.

Reviews.Title: good pic but lacks optical audio
Reviews.Author: Caperie
Reviews.Content: So far we like the picture and sound quality. However, did not realize that most sound bars and home theater sound systems are going to digital optical audio. Found a panasonic sound bar that uses hdmi, but better quality ones use the optical and do not have hdmi.  Also, be sure you have a high bite rate to use the tv connect. We only have 6 mbps and that is not enough to use the software. No app for Amazon video streaming or rentals.  Pandora is great as well as netflix.  Seems like you need to use a USB to download software updates as well.

Reviews.Title: Better options for the money.
Reviews.Author: J.
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes when I saw the features of this TV for the price. I bought this mainly for PC gaming, along with the Netflix web app on the TV. I ignored CNET's review of this TV and took a risk. CNET's review was pretty much spot on, wish I would have listened.Good:-Net TV app with built in WiFi-120HzBad:-Terrible color reproduction-Hardly any picture options. In PC mode, you only have brightness and contrast. Everything else I had to force through my video card options. In TV mode, the options are still very limited. The main set up is for dummies and consists of 4 pictures asking which you like better. From there, you don't have much control. The colors looked washed out and the black levels are horrendous once you reach a decent brightness.-Blurry picture when connected to PC over HDMI. Even with correct overscan settings, pixel format, and TV set to PC Mode, the picture was terrible compared to a monitor. Everything looked like it had morphological AA applied and was not sharp at all like a monitor. Being that a big selling point of this is the wireless PC connect, I expected much better for PC monitor use.-Net TV app menus are slow to respond. Netflix mainly, selecting through the movies is a 1-2 second delay after you press a button.I sent this TV back already because I was not satisfied at all. The average user probably won't be disappointed but I have another 3 year old Philips TV and an Asus PC monitor to compare to. This TV's picture is terrible in comparison no matter what settings you try. If you are using this for PC use, I recommend you not consider this TV at all. I love my old Philips, but they let me down with this TV. The picture/performance is what I'd expect of a lesser brand marked $100 cheaper. You can do much better for the price of this set.

Reviews.Title: Very, Very Good Value
Reviews.Author: Southeastern Mass Customer
Reviews.Content: OK so you can buy a Mercedes or you can buy a Honda. Mercedes has state of the art technology and my brother would love to sell you one for $110,000. You can spend $100 on a bottle of wine or get a $14 dollar bottle of Kendall Jackson. The Kendall tastes great, and is the Kendall Jackson of televisions. Yup I bought a $2000 Samsung for my work. But I bought this Philips for our home, and our family really loves it. We don't have cable, we get over the air digital signals. It's tuner is far stronger than the 26" Olevia we're replacing. We get 32 channels in the Boston area with beautiful picture quality via our roof mounted antenna. We have a Roku and also use the internal set-based apps. The only reason we keep the Roku is that the TV doesn't have an internal Amazon app. We also have a DVD player and a Nintendo Wii(I try to hide all the peripherals..hate that stuff in the family room).The TV served us well during the Superbowl. Although it didn't help the Patriots to win, Tom Brady was crystal clear and the TV handled the sports motion very well. We chose an Amazon open box special (love those) for $405 and paid $3.99 for next day shipping. We're very pleased with the purchase,the price, the video quality, the apps and built in wifi. If you're not a TV brand snob (face it, we all have it within us), and like to getting a deal, this is a fantastic alternative.

Reviews.Title: In response to criticisms regarding this model.  DLNA capable as well which most places don't mention.
Reviews.Author: Zen "Sometimes Zenophobic"
Reviews.Content: I had my apprehensions about this model due to the mixed reviews I read from various review sites but when I saw this unit on sale during some Holiday web promotion with free shipping I ended up pulling the trigger and I'm quite satisfied and pleased with my purchase and would like to address some of the criticisms I've read on this unit which need some clarification:Picture / Image Quality:  Much better than I expected.  A lot of the criticism pointed at the limited controls but I found the existing controls more than adequate for adjusting the picture for personal taste.  If you end up hooking this LCD up as a computer monitor, then you don't even have to deal with the built-in controls if your graphics card or PC has its own image adjustment and color correction.1080p resolution:  Read a few reviews that say this only plays in 720p using media connect which is only true if you are connecting via wi-fi or using the VGA PC port.  If your computer supports HDMI out then you get full 1080p and no issues with Blu-Ray playback and I'm currently running it at max native resolution of 1920 x 1080 using the onboard HDMI video that is supported by the HD 4000 graphics built into my Core i7 processor.  I have 2 other monitors that are using my dedicated (discreet) Nvidia card.  Extremely impressed by how the Intel 4000 graphics is handling the Philips LCD.DLNA - This LCD is DLNA capable.  Whether this was made possible through the latest firmware update, I'm not sure but it's not made mention of on many product specs or descriptions.  I'm able to access all Shared folders on my Win7 Home network and able to use Windows Media Center streaming capabilities to have my PC control and send content directly to the Philips.SMART TV Capability - Not so impressed with how the controls work for Netflix and Youtube.  RW & FF through content is a pain and there is a noticeable delay in response times when using the remote controls.  If the main reason you want to buy this LCD is for the Smart TV apps then you're better off getting a regular LCD with great image quality and buying a ROKU or hooking it up via HDMI to a PC that you can watch Netflix or Amazon video in from a web-browser and just get yourself a wireless keyboard with trackball.  After plodding around trying to browse content on Youtube and Netflix and then dealing with the horribly slow FF & RW I ended up just switching to my PC HDMI input when I want to watch streaming video.  No Amazon video which sucks but I don't see why they can't add it later on with a firmware update - in fact, this set originally didn't have Youtube and now it does.  Has a ton of HD video podcast channels from sources that I've not seen on any other Smart TV or add-on box but with the same control issues as mentioned before - some you are forced to watch the entire thing from beginning to end.Overall, if you can get this thing for under $400 then why not?  Picture is great, I like the nice solid body and stand (this model being standard LCD and not a thin LED) and the PC and media connectivity features are the best part.  If your getting this for the Smart TV features then look to a Samsung or Vizio if  you can spend a little more or do the standard LCD + Roku combo if price is a factor.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV for the money
Reviews.Author: David Haskin "daviedog"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for my kids for Christmas. It replaced a 21" Sanyo that needed to go to the curb ;)First off the price for this TV was awesome, couldn't believe the deal I got. I'm more than pleased with the picture and the features. I have another Philips 47" TV in my basement and honestly think the picture on it might be a bit better but I still need to tweak this set. The speakers on this TV are rear facing so you'll want to get this up on the wall for better sound projection or purchase a sound bar. My only complaint would be that the "Net TV" menus are pretty slow. They work great but you have to be patient for things like Netflix to fire up and once you're there don't expect to break any speed records.This is my second Philips TV and I've been more than pleased with the brand. They offer the same features as other vendors but for a much better price. My first Philips set is over 4 years old and hasn't given me a single issue. I plan on buying another larger set in the near future and will likely stick with Philips.

Reviews.Title: Nice tv for the money.
Reviews.Author: Robert Gates "snakes200"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV when it was 479.00 but they dropped the price after i had bought it so after the difference i only paid 459 and some change for it. The picture quality is pretty good even with it's lower contrast ratio vs other sets in this price range. My last TV was a philips and i didn't have any issues with that other than a blown speaker on the TV. The Net TV feature is nice but i don't see me using it much other than watching netflix on it. Blu-rays look amazing on this tv, the sound could be better but it is not bad overall. I plan on buying a sound bar for this once i can afford to. PS3 games look great on it and the 120hz processing make for some really high frame rates. I would highly recommend this TV to a friend.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Kaija
Reviews.Content: This is my first HDTV, and it is working out great. The setup was easy and we were watching TV and playing Wii in no time. I am amazed by the HD quality with Comcast cable box. The colors look great, sound is good, although looking forward to getting a Blue-ray player with sound system. Even hooked up my iPhone to use it to listen to music, worked great. I paid $549, and I think I got good value for the money.Update 3/25/14: Still going strong, I have not seen a need to update to a newer model. It's on a lot, no issues whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: Perfecto! if all you want is a good quality picture and size for a good price.
Reviews.Author: Richie-Rich
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV after the New Year at a stellar price. I wanted a 40'at a deal and I got it. I wanted user friendly menu keys-got it. It is HD compatible-got it. I actually chose this product because it was different than some of its competitors, by having wireless capabilities. I figured since I do use my laptop often, it would be a great experiment to try to wireless project my laptop to the 40'. Well, downloaded the software from the Phillips cite, and it does not work. It wasn't a big deal, but I thought that this was the difference, amongst it TM, that influenced me to buy it.Also, it picks up secured signals very well, but not unsecured wireless signals. Maybe this TV has some hidden anti-virus protection that blocks connections to unsecured wireless networks.Of course, the audio is decent, but I tried to use the AV outputs from my Aiwa Stereo system. Maybe I'm too outdated, with my old equipment, but it will not disperse audio through the outputs when connected. Bummer! I guess I will have to upgrade the sound system and us the HDMI ports. Hopefully, it works.Overall, this is a great buy if all you want is a name brand, great picture, and decent sound. Its worth the price. 3 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: Not for MAC users
Reviews.Author: Heidi
Reviews.Content: This is not compatible with MAC. I bought it after reading all of the product information from consumer websites and the manufacturer. It does not state it is ONLY microsoft pc compatible until you read the owner's manual. The picture quality is fantastic. The product information is unfortunately misleading.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Jevoapartir
Reviews.Content: Everything about the TV is just great. Sound, Picture, Features... You can even wirelessly connect your laptop to it WIRELESSLY The only draw back I have noticed is there is a little lag time with the remote, maybe it is because of the fact that the TV is in fact a Computer sometimes it takes it a little while to think, especially with netflix.

Reviews.Title: Lacking features
Reviews.Author: wolfvilleian
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for just over a year now and like the TV for being just that, a TV. Picture is good, sound is okay (don't expect much from built in speakers).If you're looking to get this TV for the Media Connect feature it offers, make sure that it will actually do what you expect.I bought this TV specifically because it had the ability to connect to my computer over WiFi (Media Connect) and share the screen. This works without issue most of the time. I download a lot of my TV shows and movies and don't have an issue playing them back through WiFi screen sharing. However if you have a DVD with copy protection in your DVD drive it will NOT let you use WiFi screen sharing. Aka You can't watch copy protected DVD's with WiFi screen sharing, you have to get it online somehow or rip it to your computer..Really Philips? Now say I've downloaded the movie and want to watch it on my TV, great! No problem there, pops up on my TV and starts playing, but the sound is way too loud and my dog has hidden the remote somewhere so you go to turn the volume down from the TV itself, YOU CAN'T ADJUST THE VOLUME!Just thought people should know these drawbacks. I now understand why the person at Best Buy didn't tell me them. They wouldn't have sold any!

Reviews.Title: Philips 40PFL5706/F7
Reviews.Author: b
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this tv!  It was surprising shipped quickly however, the tv did not work properly.  With the technical difficulties I contacted Philips and providing proof of purchase they gladly shipped me a brand new one.  Sadly I just had to wait an additional 2 weeks. All I'd like to pass on to buyers is BE SURE to read reviews and ratings of the specific seller before purchasing!  The tv is a great component to the household and business with its WIFI and media connect features :)

Reviews.Title: Good value, excellent picture
Reviews.Author: Ben Franklin
Reviews.Content: Not our main TV but this is a great option if you are looking for a good quality LCD TV at a great price. The setup is straightforward and it connects easily into the Internet. Easy access to Netflix and Pandora plus a host of others. The is no optical SPDIF output on the TV which is surprising since SPDIF is a Phillips technology but RCA out works almost as well. I mounted my TV using a Cheetah Mounts bracket Cheetah Mounts Plasma LCD Flat Screen TV Articulating Full Motion Dual Arm Wall Mount Bracket For 32-65" Displays Up To 165LBS Black With 10' High Speed HDMI Cable With Ethernet Fits Up To 24" Studs. Side hdmi plus PC RGB USB AND Audio in all on the side. 3HDMI slots on rear along with ant in, component video and composite video in plus gigital audio out. No SVideo.  The tv comes ready for either wired or wireless Internet connection.

Reviews.Title: Randomly Turns Off + Green Resolution When Connected To Laptop
Reviews.Author: Amazon User
Reviews.Content: After only 2 years of having this TV, it began to show MAJOR problems.  First, it randomly turns off after it turns on, and you need to wait about one minute for it to turn back on.  Also, when it's connected to my laptop with a wire, the image on the TV is green.  I called Amazon to see if they could help me out (when I purchased this product, it was sold and shipped by Amazon); however, because this product is no longer sold or shipped by Amazon and because they only have a 30-day return policy, they could not replace the item for me.  They did, however, give me a 20% credit.  Philips was also no help as they only have a 1 year warranty.  Therefore, I'm stuck with a television that doesn't function properly.  Do not purchase this product.

Reviews.Title: Needs to be faster with wireless internet.......
Reviews.Author: Tobie R Och
Reviews.Content: Would not buy this tv again. Picture is ok, could be better. wireless internet is very very slow. Get what you pay for I guess

Reviews.Title: I'd recomend this over more expensive units
Reviews.Author: AJC
Reviews.Content: Good TV for the price. The picture excels and its chocked full of features. This is the unit we have in the bedroom, but the picture rivals the much more expensive unit in the living room.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing
Reviews.Author: TERRANCE O'SHEI "poverello"
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I wanted a reasonably priced TV that had builtin WiFi for Netflix and other services.The user interface for this is slooooooooooow. There's a few second delay between pressing a button and the screen catching up. I am contacting the manufacturer now because of multiple problems: the TV spontaneously shuts off, the video completely disappears, all channels have image ghosting, etc.I would never buy a Philips TV again.

Reviews.Title: Good pictures, and great stereophonic sound.
Reviews.Author: Festus Ogunbitan
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is good, and the sound is great. But the refresh is slow from channels to channels. If Phillips can work  on this it would be much better. But on the overall, this is a great tv, and it is worth the money. It has everything that Phillips advertised before I decided to buy it.

Reviews.Title: Hd tv
Reviews.Author: Miquel Vinales
Reviews.Content: Good tv nice picture very smooth,cool quality is nice not LG tv but it beats most, also it has wifi can't live without that cool for Netflix & etc.

Reviews.Title: very satisfied
Reviews.Author: Mark Twain
Reviews.Content: nice bright picture, very crisp. sound is acceptable. plenty of inputs. no dead pixels. good price. the net apps are a bit slow to load, but i don't plan on using them much. no real complaints.

Reviews.Title: Fair picture, money's worth
Reviews.Author: Sunny
Reviews.Content: Something I wanted in my bedroom, happy with the picture and wireless net connectivity makes it handy to watch from YouTube etc.

Reviews.Title: love the tv, features are a bit finicky
Reviews.Author: G. Brown
Reviews.Content: turns on slow, the media connect screen share is only up to 720p, technology limit, i dont blame philips. the software for browsing pc isnt working right for me, the philips forums are helpful but i havent resolved why it wont work, i can browse all the way to the file but cant play, so -1 star for these few setbacks, other than that, its a wonderful tv, i got a good deal on it at the time of purchase.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV, Great Value
Reviews.Author: Bronco
Reviews.Content: Site to Store was easy and quick. I did a fairly comprehensive review of all the available flat screens. I shopped both online outlets and brick and mortar retailers. This was buy far the best deal I found for the size class and features. As far as performance, it's video and audio more than meet my expectations. I'm using the TV in my small bedroom, so it works great for my particular application. The picture setup wizard makes it simple to configure the TV based on your preferences. Picture is sharp, and the on board speakers work well enough for my needs. The wifi setup was easy. I was online in less than 5 minutes. Updating the firmware through the wifi connection worked fine.  Other than the online update, I've used the Media Connect feature through the wifi connection.  I haven't used any of the online apps, so I'll comment on this feature later.  The only downside I've experienced is the Media Connect takes more than the 1 GB RAM I had on my laptop.  After I added 2 GB of RAM only to discover the wifi connection isn't stable enough to watch more than a few minutes of PC content.  When it did work the picture was sharper than I expected, at least as sharp as SD.  The audio seemed intermittent as well.  When it worked it was a bit low in comparison with the normal level produced from the cable box programming.

Reviews.Title: philips 40 in. tv
Reviews.Author: George J. Smith
Reviews.Content: am real pleased with this tv. only thing is it has very little volume. mybe  some one can help me with this problem. may be philips can. have anyone had any luck by calling them.

Reviews.Title: Philips TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Great TV. The only problem is that it has no analog audio output. It has digital audio out , and I had to purchase a converter to use ear phones.

Reviews.Title: No gaming mode
Reviews.Author: P. Walsh "chessdad"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this specifically for gaming but I should have done more research.  The lag was dramatic and there was no option to configure the TV for use while gaming.  Returned it within days and purchase a Plasma instead.

Reviews.Title: Poor color
Reviews.Author: Kathy Russell
Reviews.Content: I let the return date slip up on me. I've tried and tried to adjust the color forthis tv. Nothing works. I will call Phillips and get some help, but so far I wishI had bought a set at a store and not have to worry about returning it.Bottom line, the color is terrible. I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: smithriver
Reviews.Content: Good picture, the only problem with it is the remote lags, so you end up thinking it isn't doing anything and press too many buttons.  Must press and wait with this one.

Reviews.Title: phillips 40" hdtv wireless net tv
Reviews.Author: visionrke
Reviews.Content: i had to return this tv because it was too large for my entertainment center. i was excited to try it out, but did not do so because of the size issue. i did notice also that in order to utilize the wireless net, you had to purchase a lifetime plan. i didn't care for this requirement because i felt if you are already paying for internet services, i didn't feel getting double billed was fair:( the return process was execellent.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: jennifer
Reviews.Content: love finally having a cool tv. great with netflix, youtube and pandora right there. i just wish there were more cool apps. The games are a joke. media connect thing is cool. movies look great. great sound quality.update 3/5/13: Still love it. finally got rid of the box! weve definitely been using pandora and netflix. its so much bigger than our old tv...its really cool.

Reviews.Title: A good buy for the money
Reviews.Author: Lewis W. Cunningham "Wayne Cunningham"
Reviews.Content: I bought the non-Internet model at Target With the LED  panel with 120mhz 1080 dpi  for $499 + tax, bought it home and was about to setup realizing it was LCD & not LED. So i contacted Target they were at front door to do exchange nice thing about it is my Target door is only 2 blocks away. What was not so nice it was 102% 4Th of July 2011 ouch.  Setup and call Phillips customer support  someone answered on the 3rd ring thinking because it was a weekend  no one would be available and wow perfect English and I ask were they are located and it was either North Carolina or Kentucky. So they help me setup the HDTV.  I went out to feed my dog and came back in TV was black humm OK thought it went into sleep mode called customer service back did as they stated to do unplug it for about 1min TV came back on and watch for the rest of the day. Sunday came home from church turn TV on screen black humm OK unplug it again still not coming on.  OK Customer support again sadly they stated that the TV might have been drop and tuner was broken bummer. They said take it back to Target crap. Call Target guess what they do not have one in stock and were not going to order anymore but they stated the other stores had 1 or 2 left. So I took TV to other store and let hem know that if I get another bad one I am going to report them to BBB. So took that home setup as before and it been just find in July I bought Phillips 3 yr warranty and feel that I got a good buy even with all the hassle. I wanted to get another one for bedroom but I not been able to find this set locally brand new for same price  bummer.  Oh well maybe Phillips will come out with some new ones for same price time will tell.  But like others I want the biggest bang for the buck I can get and Sharp, LG, Sam sung, all have 40,42,47, 50, LED smart tv and some 3d for under a grand so that might even be a better buy.
